categoryData.displaySubtitle: My direct debit failed, my transfer hasn't arrived...

answer.answer:
There are a couple of common reasons a Direct Debit can fail. In both instances you should get in touch with the merchant to make sure the Direct Debit is properly set up. 

__If there wasn‚Äôt enough money in your account__

If you don‚Äôt have enough money in your account when the Direct Debit is scheduled to go out, it‚Äôll fail. If that happens, we will retry the Direct Debit. If the company collecting the Direct Debit is unable to charge your account they will usually get in touch with you directly to collect the money within a couple of days. 

__If the other company didn‚Äôt give us your Direct Debit instruction__

Sometimes, a company won‚Äôt send us the ‚Äòmandate‚Äô that shows you‚Äôve given them permission to collect money from your account. Or they might try to collect the money before they‚Äôve sent the mandate through. In either case, the Direct Debit will fail.
If a standing order fails, the most common reason is there wasn‚Äôt enough money in your account. It won‚Äôt automatically retry, so you‚Äôll need to make a one-off bank transfer instead.

helpArticles.question: A bank transfer I'm expecting hasn't arrived

answer.answer:
Although bank transfers typically arrive in seconds, they can take up to a whole day.

If you haven‚Äôt received your payment after 1 working day we recommend getting in touch with the sending bank. Quite often other banks run additional checks on payments before they send them. Once we receive the payment it will be applied to your account instantly.

If you are able to contact them please ask for the 18 digit TRN (transaction reference number).

Some people report delayed payments coming from HSBC accounts. This is usually due to checks that HSBC are running on their side.

For these payments:

‚Ä¢ If your transfer was sent before 6pm, it will be processed by HSBC before 9pm that same day. Once they have processed it, it should arrive within 4 hours. If the transfer hasn‚Äôt arrived by 11pm please get in touch with HSBC to make sure that they have processed it.

‚Ä¢ If your transfer was sent between 6pm and 11:45pm, you will have missed their cut-off time to guarantee it‚Äôll arrive the same day. If the transfer is not going to arrive the same day, you‚Äôll see message in your HSBC app that states the payment cannot be sent until the next day.
If you‚Äôre in any doubt about whether a payment looks legitimate, get in touch with us through in-app chat and we‚Äôll investigate.

**If you haven't activated your new card in your app**

You can activate it here: [Activate your card](monzo://activate_replacement)

**If you can see a decline message in your app**

Tap on the declined payment in your app for more information. If the decline message is unclear, please chat to us.

**If your card doesn't work at a particular merchant, but other cards do**

It's likely the merchant hasn't configured their systems correctly to accept our cards. In this case you won't even see a decline message in your app.

We can reach out to them for you to try and fix the issue.

Please [chat to us](monzo://support_chat?from=button-help-article) and provide:

1. The **name of the merchant or ATM provider** where your card's been declined
2. The **address** of the store or ATM (or web address if your card is declined online)
3. The **time and date** of the attempted payment
4. The **amount** of the attempted payment
5. A **receipt or screenshot** showing a decline or a successful payment with a different card ****(We can use this to diagnose the exact issue with the merchant's payment systems)
6. A **brief summary** of what happened

helpArticles.question: Why are my contactless card payments being declined?

answer.answer:
After every few contactless payments, you'll need to retry with Chip & PIN. Once you've paid with Chip & PIN, contactless payments will work again. This is because of new security rules, affecting all banks. 

Some places might not be ready for this change yet, so will show a regular decline message. We'll send you a notification when you need to retry with Chip & PIN, and let you know in advance if your next payment needs to use Chip & PIN.

These rules don't affect Apple Pay and Google Pay payments, or Transport for London payments where chip & PIN isn't available.

helpArticles.question: My card payment declined, but I've still been charged

answer.answer:
If the payment declined on the merchant's end but went through on your app, this might be because of a problem with their card machine.

To get your money back:

- Pick the payment you'd like to question
- Scroll down and tap 'Something wrong? Tell us!'
- you can either question the payment and get your money back straightaway. Or you can wait and automatically get the money back in 7 days.

Your refund will take up to 14 days from when the merchant processes it. If you‚Äôve been waiting more than 14 days, please check that the merchant definitely sent the money.

If you need to send an item back to get your refund, the 14 days will only begin once the merchant receives the item. So make sure you've accounted for that.

If the merchant confirms that they've sent the refund, you've allowed 14 days, and your refund still hasn't arrived, please get in touch with:

1. Proof of the original receipt (screenshot or photo of paper receipt)
2. Proof you spoke to the merchant (screenshot of the email you sent them)
3. Optional: proof of cancellation (screenshot if you tried to cancel the order)

We won't be able to help unless you have these and 14 days have passed üóìÔ∏è

__Getting your car rental or hotel deposit refund__

If you're expecting a deposit refund from a car rental company or hotel, it'll take around 30 days.

Need it sooner? Get in touch with proof from the merchant confirming that they plan to refund your deposit.

When you use a card online, a lot of merchants will make a small ‚Äòtest‚Äô payment to make sure you‚Äôve given them the right details and your card is active.

These tend to be for around ¬£0 or ¬£1, but some merchants test with more. Normally, they‚Äôll refund the amount right away but it can take up to 8 days. 

If you've got an active card check that's more than ¬£0, you can go to the transaction details in your feed, tap "Something wrong? Tell us" and question the payment to have it reversed.

helpArticles.question: Why is my payment still pending?

answer.answer:
When you make a payment, it happens in two parts. First, we set the money aside in your account so you can‚Äôt spend it ‚Äì that‚Äôs when we create a transaction in your app.

Then the merchant comes to collect the money, usually a couple of days later. 

In the time between us setting it aside and the merchant collecting, the payment is ‚Äòpending‚Äô, so we put a note on the transaction to let you know.

helpArticles.question: Can I pay with a frozen card?

answer.answer:
When you freeze your card, we‚Äôll block all payments we can so you won‚Äôt be able to use your card in most situations. That includes anything through Google or Apple Pay. If you‚Äôve frozen your card and see any strange activity, please [get in touch with us and we‚Äôll investigate](monzo://support_chat?from=button-help-article "get in touch with us").

You can unfreeze your card by tapping 'Unfreeze' under your card on the Home tab.

If you put the wrong PIN in too many times when making a payment, we block your card to keep it safe üîí

Follow these steps to recover your PIN:

1. Tap the __Home__ icon in the menu bar
2. Tap the __PIN & card number__ button under your Monzo card (if you can't find this button, swipe down on your list of payments)
3. Tap __Get a PIN reminder__

You'll need to show some ID and take a photo of your face üì∏

We can‚Äôt stop transactions which happen offline (like through TfL, on planes or hotel bills) and so they might still go through. If you go over your authorised overdraft limit, or enter an unauthorised overdraft, we‚Äôll expect you to add enough money to get back inside your limit as soon as possible.

helpArticles.question: Is my Monzo card protected under Section 75?

answer.answer:
No, Section 75 only applies to credit cards. But if you've got an issue with a transaction we can try to get the money back by raising what's called a 'chargeback' on your behalf. 

Tap on the transaction you have a problem with, then __Something wrong? Tell us!__ to report the issue to our team for review.

helpArticles.question: What happens if I'm overcharged or I order items that never arrive?

answer.answer:
If you were charged too much or the items you ordered didn't arrive, we can raise what's called a 'chargeback' with Mastercard to get your money back. 

If you've got an issue you'd like us to look at, please chat to us in the app.

This process can take up to 3 months ‚Äì we're sorry it takes so long, but this is the guidance Mastercard have set out for us and we can't change how long it takes.

helpArticles.question: I couldn't approve an online payment

answer.answer:
Some online payments use 3D Secure, which protects against unauthorised use of your card. A merchant can choose to request this verification if they want to make sure it‚Äôs you making the payment. You can approve this in two different ways: - By opening your Monzo app, pressing approve and entering your card's PIN - By requesting a code via text message (SMS), then entering that code
Some merchants don't allow you to do the first option, so if a payment fails please try again and press "Use SMS" instead üëç

Some online payments use 3D Secure, which protects against unauthorised use of your card by asking you to do extra approval. 

A merchant can request this if they want to make sure it‚Äôs actually you making the payment, which is why you sometimes need to approve transactions before they go through.

Usually, you‚Äôll be asked for your PIN to make a payment (unless you‚Äôre using contactless to pay for something under ¬£30). We‚Äôll receive your instruction immediately. If you don‚Äôt want to make a payment, don‚Äôt authorise the payment with your PIN or Touch ID. 

In some instances, when you don‚Äôt have your PIN you can authorise payments using the details on your card. If you don‚Äôt want to authorise the payment, you shouldn‚Äôt enter the details on your card.

__Standing orders and Direct Debits__

__Setting up a standing order__
You can set up a standing order in the app. 

Head to the ‚ÄòPayments‚Äô tab, you should see a bar that has ‚ÄòScheduled payments‚Äô. 

Tap on ‚ÄòAdd Scheduled Payment‚Äô and enter the details of who you want to pay. When you enter the amount you want to pay, remember to swipe ‚ÄòSchedule Payment‚Äô to choose the payment date and whether it‚Äôs a recurring payment. We receive your instruction for all the payments at this point. 

__Setting up a Direct Debit__
To set up a Direct Debit you‚Äôll need to contact the organisation you want to pay, and give them your account number and sort code. 

We get the payment order on the working day before we take the money from your account. You‚Äôll see it in your feed as a scheduled payment. We‚Äôll try to collect the money at 02:00 the day after getting the order. 

__Cancelling standing orders and Direct Debits__
You can cancel a standing order or Direct Debit in the app too. 

Head to the ‚ÄòPayments‚Äô tab, you should see a bar that has ‚ÄòScheduled payments‚Äô. 
Tap on the instruction you‚Äôd like to cancel and you'll then see the 'Cancel standing order / Direct Debit' option. 

Please remember you need to cancel before the payment happens,  so we recommend cancelling at least one day before the next payment is due to make sure you‚Äôre not charged. For a Direct Debit, please also tell the organisation.

__How to make international payments__
You can make international money transfers from within your Monzo app! 
In the ‚ÄòPayments‚Äô tab, tap ‚ÄòSend via bank transfer‚Äô. 

Tap ‚ÄòInternational Transfer‚Äô and you can use TransferWise to send money abroad. 
The first time you use this feature you‚Äôll need to give us permission to use your TransferWise account. If you don‚Äôt have a TransferWise account, we‚Äôll create one for you when you send the money.

For the Nearby Friends feature to work, both you and the sender/receiver must: 

- Have our most up-to-date app
- Have a Monzo account
- Be within 30 metres of each other
- Have Bluetooth switched on
- Enable 'Payments with friends' in settings via the Profile page on your Account tab on your iOS device and Settings on your Account tab on your Android device.   
- Be on the Friends Nearby screen in the 'Payment' tab at the same time

If you've checked all this and it's still not working, let us know and we can take a closer look!

helpArticles.question: My Monzo friend didn‚Äôt get my payment

answer.answer:
If you‚Äôre trying to send money to a Monzo account and it won‚Äôt work, check that:

- you both have ‚ÄòPayments with Friends‚Äô switched on in your apps 
- you‚Äôre connected to the internet

helpArticles.question: I can‚Äôt send money to someone on Monzo

answer.answer:
If you‚Äôre trying to send money to a Monzo account and it won‚Äôt work, check that:

- you both have ‚ÄòPayments with Friends‚Äô switched on in your apps (you can find this in your settings)
- you‚Äôre connected to the internet

---

If that‚Äôs all fine, and you‚Äôre still having trouble, there might be something up with the recipient‚Äôs account. Ask them to get in touch with us through in-app chat and we‚Äôll take a look!

In some cases, merchants won‚Äôt give us everything we need to show a transaction in your feed straight away, but your balance will still change. So it can look like everything doesn‚Äôt add up.

This usually fixes itself in within 24 hours, when the merchant gives us what we need. If your balance still looks wrong once all your transactions are up to date, please do get in touch with us.
